result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse James Mannise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo a domestic violence assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment recommended within 21 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  This agreement may be revoked if the defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole, regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 80 hours of community service within 21 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain full time, verifiable employment in an occupation acceptable to agent.

Defendant will not voluntarily quit his employment without agent approval.

Comply with any assessments, follow-up treatment, conditions and no contacts per agent.

Take prescribed medications as prescribed.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment in an occupation acceptable to agent and will not quit employment unless approved by probation agent.

Undergo domestic violence assessment and follow through with treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Complete and comply with any conditions, no contacts, treatment or assessments per agent.

Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and take exactly as directed to be taken.

No drug paraphernalia.

Complete diversion orientation no later than October 30, 2015.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
